overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a methodical approach to time-series forecasting with hourly data, starting with advanced model considerations (SARIMA) but ultimately adopting a simple averaging method due to data limitations and computational constraints. The analysis effectively identifies daily seasonality and handles data completeness, though the short historical dataset (only 4 days) limits complex modeling. The final forecast relies on heuristic pattern repetition with careful rounding and date handling.
key_insights: Daily seasonality is the dominant pattern, requiring hourly aggregation for forecasting
Short data length (4 days) necessitates simplification from advanced models (SARIMA) to heuristic methods
Averaging same-hour values across historical days creates a representative daily profile
Forecast generation via repetition of the averaged daily pattern for the horizon period
Explicit handling of data rounding and datetime sequencing for output consistency
complexity_analysis: Moderate initial complexity with statistical model exploration, but ultimately simplified to heuristic execution due to data limitations. Includes multi-step validation (trend checks, seasonality confirmation) but avoids computational implementation.
